name: LSE Northumberland House

reviews.title: Great location, facilities & value for money in the middle of London!
reviews.text: As I was meeting up with some girls on a hen weekend I didn't want to stay in a big hotel costing a fortune but needed to be central so this was a bargain. Reception and welcome were lovely, I felt safe at all times, the room was very clean and although the bathroom was tiny (like the toilets on an aircraft), it had everything I needed. I had a room across the hall from a kitchen which I thought might be noisy but it wasn't at all and that was on a Saturday night in July. Would definitely stay again - not bad for £60!

reviews.title: Excellent Stay - Location Amazing!
reviews.text: This hotel is perfect if you want a basic place to sleep and get ready to go out. The location is brilliant, soo many landmarks/pubs/restaurants etc within walking distance. Definately worth a stay if you want a cheap hotel with excellent location! The hotel is clean and tidy and the staff are friendly.

reviews.title: Great location
reviews.text: Stayed there for three weeks while attending a summer course so we had to find somewhere not so expensive to stay. Northumberland House was the perfect choice! It has the best location we could find, we were in a walking distance to almost everywhere we wanted to go, and if not, the underground was just 1 minute walk away. We had a twin room so it was big enough for both of us. The bathroom we got was kind of big, which I wasn't expecting after reading other reviews. The bed were made almost everyday and the towels changed, but the sheets were only changed once in my three weeks stay. Northumberland Avenue is a great street, a lot more quiet than the streets near. The staff was very helpful if we needed something.

reviews.title: Excellent!
reviews.text: I don't think I can say anything bad about our stay at Northumberland House. If you're looking for some cheap place to stay while in London, this is definately the best choice you can make!

reviews.title: Best value in London
reviews.text: Great value for money and in a very central location. Very noisy if you have a room on the road-side.

The front desk staff were very helpful. The early check-in was very nice. The room is a basic dorm room. There is a very small pre-fab bath in the room. Despite being close to Trafalgar Square, it was fairly quiet. There is a shared kitchen in a nearby room. Laundry facilities are in the basement. No TV in the room, although I saw one in the kitchen. Phone cards are available with very good international rates. I was able to find an open wi-fi network from my room. Room was cleaned each day. The central location made it very convenient to return thru the day for a break.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: The only down side, despite being cool at night, it still seemed a little stuffy in the room. The window opened a little, but either a small fan or a lighter bed covering would be nice.
reviews.title: Great value for money

reviews.text: We paid £67 for an ensuite twin room, which really was a bargain in such a great location. Service was good, the room was very clean. The bedroom itself was very spacious and yes the bathroom 'pod' was tiny, but perfectly adequate. We asked for a room at the back of the building so as not to have too much traffic noise and it was fine, very quiet. Only negative really was the pillows, very hard! Apart from that, would definitely recommend staying here if you're after cheap, basic and clean.
reviews.title: Great location, good service, the rooms are very basic but clean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This student accododation, which rents out rooms during the vacation periods, is literally 50 meters from Trafalgar Square, so you can't beat the location.
reviews.title: excellent value in the heart of london, no pigeons,ooooh, perfect.

reviews.text: It offers a quite good service: access to kitchens, computers with internet in the lobby (1 GBP= 20 minutes), luggage storage after check-out. The staff is helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent Location, Great Value, Clean, Great Staff!

reviews.text: This place gives you a fantastic opportunity to explore the central London attractions without all the hustle and bustle of travelling by tube. Located just few steps from Trafalgar Square, this hotel has only two shortcomings - no breakfast and a very small bathroom. The kitchen is not exceptionally clean, but you can make a cup of tea there. Moreover, Tesco is located 2 minutes from there and plenty of cafes and take-aways are nearby as well. The view from the back rooms isn´t particulary nice (a backyard and walls), but those rooms are incredibly quiet at night! All in all, I am going to book my accommodation there again when I am in London. This is real value for money.
reviews.title: Trafalgar Square on your doorstep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great location on Northumberland Ave just south of Trafalgar Sq.
reviews.title: The best location for the price in London

reviews.text: Friendly, helpful staff (luggage storage, order a cab, restaurant ideas, etc)
reviews.title: Wow is all it needs

reviews.text: Plain, large rooms with small bath are very clean
reviews.title: well worth the stay

reviews.text: Ability to purchase shampoo, toothpaste, etc. from staff would be a nice addition
reviews.title: 5* location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here 4 nights.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, worn carpet, tiny bathroom

reviews.text: Plus points first. It was cheap for London at £70 a night in total for the two of us. The location couldn't be more central - you're about 15 seconds walk from Trafalgar Square. I've stayed in 'central London' hotels before which require a 15 minute tube journey to see the sights - but here, everything is literally on your doorstep. Staff at reception are friendly. There are kitchens on each floor if you want to go self-catering.
reviews.title: Can't beat the location

reviews.text: Negative points: this is student accommodation, so the rooms are basic. You don't get a TV or aircon. The carpet in our room was worn and a bit dirty. The loo and shower were tiny - the interior was about 3ft by 3 ft and so not suitable if you are humungously fat.
reviews.title: Wow, what a great place!!!

reviews.text: But ..... the location is astonishing. You are right slap bang in the absolute dead centre of London. It's even in a better position than 10 Downing Street, although I imagine the bathrooms there are a bit bigger.
reviews.title: Great location but unpleasant with little ventilation and no internet

reviews.text: So overall, considering the price, it was well worth it.
reviews.title: Great Stay Great Bathroom

aka: London School Of Economics Northumberland House Hotel
description: Northumberland House provides great value self-catered accommodation in a magnificent Grade II listed building just off Trafalgar Square.The accommodation is perfectly placed for all of the tourist attractions in central London- theatres, museums, galleries, Covent Garden and Regent Street are all within easy walking distance.With its historic building, great location, affordable prices and modern facilities (including en-suite throughout), Northumberland House is one of the most attractive places to stay in central London
